Language.name: english
Language.string:
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Starts off with an Ox cart, a homestead wagon that provides a gathering buff, and gain one when you age up. Mercenary units are more expensive but are stronger.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Royal guard units:</color>
Musketeer (Landsoldat) and Hussar (Zealand Life)
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Ox Cart, Ski Infantry, Friskytte and Rytter

The Kingdom of Denmark asserted itself as a significant power in Northern Europe through its strategic use of naval supremacy and disciplined military forces. Its artillery and fortified defenses played a pivotal role in battles, particularly during conflicts like the Thirty Years' War. Despite challenges posed by a relatively small population, Denmark maintained its strength by leveraging alliances and employing skilled mercenaries to bolster its armies. This adaptability allowed Denmark to remain influential across the region for centuries

<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Civilization bonus:</color>
Torps gather nearby resources. Jaeger and Black Rider mercenaries can always be recruited from the Tavern. Mercenary shipments are cheaper and arrive more quickly. Advanced improvements available at the Arsenal.
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Royal guard units:</color>
Pikeman (Dalkarl) and Hakkapelit (Drabant)
<color=1.0, 1.0, 0.0>Unique units:</color>
Carolean, Leather Cannon and Hakkapelit

The Swedish Empire became one of the greatest in Europe through innovation in military tactics and logistics. Its artillery and cavalry charges dominated the battlefields, particularly during the Thirty Years War. Despite a relatively small population, the Swedes fielded some of the largest armies in Europe, partly through the recruitment of mercenaries.

Christian IV is an ambitious and resourceful leader, known for his relentless pursuit of military and economic dominance. He invests heavily in fortifications and artillery to secure strategic advantage on the battlefield. Christian IV prefers methodical campaigns, leveraging his navy and disciplined infantry to control territories and outmaneuver opponents.
Danish Musketeer attack and hitpoints greatly increased. Cost is reduced.
Danish Hussar attack, hitpoints and range resist greatly increased.
Your Ox Carts can now build military buildings as well.
Control over the Øresund strait allows you enforce this tax. Your Docks now trickle Coin and even more if you have researched Öresund Customs, but now have a build limit.
Grants a Royal Grenadier with all future shipments and allies you with the House of Oldenburg.
Transforms into a Mill, Estate or Livestock Pen. Can garrison into buildings for protection. Boosts Settler production.
Good at exploring, fishing or transport.
Delivers 6 Bosniaks. Enables Bosniak hiring at the Tavern.
Economic building that combines Mill and Livestock Pen, as well as supports some population.
Sends two Minke Whales. Fishing Boats gather from Whales faster.
Grants a Royal Grenadier with all future shipments and enables them to be recruited at Oldenburg Trading Posts.
Improves your Danish Explorer in combat, and gives him a canine companion. Trade Routes yield more resources.
Trees last significantly longer and Settlers gather wood from trees quicker.
More Kanonjoller can be built and they now have abonus versus ships.
Sends two Ox Carts. Ox Carts can now build Outposts and the build limit for Outposts have increased.
Settlers now gather Coin from Trees.
Ships 6 Ski Infantry and enables them and their imperial upgrades in the barracks.
Villagers gather Coin from Mines faster. Torps gather coin +100% more quickly from mines. Mines last longer.
Grants 8 Ski Infantry. Your Settlers become Sjømenn, and can be called from docks and garrisoned into warships to improve attack.
Allows your Town Center to Train Ox Carts. Increases Ox cart build limit by 1.
Ships a mighty Battleship! Danish Battleships have increase in range and grants them the Long-range bombardment ability.
Provides your Church with unique Danish improvements.
Delivers 10 Cows carrying additional 150 food; Cow train limit +10.
Ships 10 Musketeers and Musketeers gain additional Hitpoints when around allied buildings.
Friskytte now gain the stealth ability.

Being over aggressive allows your artillery to deal more damage but it will be hard to reaquire more if they are lost. Artillery damage and area of effect is increased but so is their cost and train time.
Ships an army of pikemen and increases their melee armor and their bonus verus cavalry.
Ships a number of Chakram Mercenaries that do area damage against infantry and buildings.
Enables Hand Cannoneer and Hackapell hiring at the Tavern
Guard upgrade for Pikemen can be researched for free. Imperial Pikemen has a reduced price.
Pikeman, Musketeer, Ski Infantry and Grenadier attack and health increased.
Ski Infantry and Friskytte gain increased stats around resources and gain bonus against similar units.
